reviews.text: Ideally situated for the museums. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Our booking included an executive breakfast which was taken in a smaller, quieter location than the dining room but as we were travelling with a small child we preferred to go to the main one and this was accomodated without a problem.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Breakfast was disappointing but for the price and the location this hotel suited us perfectly.
reviews.title: Excellent experience
Not great value
reviews.text: The hotel exceeded my expectations. I had reserved a single occupancy room and I was expecting a rather small room, but instead I got a big, comfortable and modern room. The location is great, just a few minutes away from the South Kensington station, the staff was extremely polite and helpful and in general I was very satisfied. I would totally recommend it.
On the downside, the only things I noticed is that there was no hair dryer (I could have asked for one) and no mini bar, but that did not bother me.
reviews.title: Resonable Price but Poor Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here when I came to London at short notice and my normal hotel was full. Location is good and the reception area very opulent. Once you get upstairs it's pretty soulless and you could be in any hotel in the world. Rooms very small, something that London hotels are good at.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel!
Overall very pleased with our 4 night stay.....
reviews.text: My wife and 2 daughters stayed for 4 nights and were very pleased. The two room set up with the sofa bed accommodated us very nicely. As mentioned in other reviews the hotel is very well located in an upscale neighborhood with easy walks to many restaurants, museums and the South Kensington tube station. The hotel is in excellent condition and we found our room to be spotless and everything in perfect working order.Our room included the buffet breakfast which was very good and served in a very comfortable restaurant. The staff was friendly and were very attentive to our needs. We would definitely recommend this hotel and we plan to stay here again on our next trip to London.
This hotel is pretty much equidistant between South Ken and Gloucester Rd tube stations. It is within easy reach of a wide range of restaurants, cafes and shops.
reviews.title: Good value: smart, clean with lovely staff
nice hotel and great location
reviews.text: Check in was efficient and front desk staff very helpful. Finding my room proved a bit of a challenge: the hotel felt like a rabbit warren although I soon got my bearings. I would not however have fancied my chances finding my way back after a few too many. Once I got to my room though I was very pleased with the accommodation. Super comfy bed, very clean room and good use of technology. There were plenty of well situated sockets to charge laptop etc and a good choice of lighting levels from bright enough to read and work through to subdued night lights.

The wifi was free which is an important consideration for me and it worked well. The breakfast buffet offered a good range of choices and a colleague had a cooked breakfast which received a thumbs up.
reviews.title: Good hotel. Staff weren't great...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would be happy to return here.
reviews.title: So warm...

reviews.text: My husband and I recently spent 5 days at the Regency. It is a very large property near Old Brompton Road, close to Imperial College, the V&A, Harrods and the South Kensington Underground Station. The staff were very welcoming, we had a nice buffet breakfast included, and the room was very clean. The location is terrific--away from the Piccadilly crush but on 3 major tube lines. Plus a nice walk through Soho to the Birdcage Walk and down to Westminister. The only drawbacks would be the room size and the very hard bed. We had a standard double which was a bit small for us. It was difficult to negotiate from the closet to the bathroom. The room, though, was fairly new with a very nice shower.
reviews.title: Small rooms but great location

reviews.text: This is a modest rambling hotel in the Kensington area and proximate to the V&A , Science, and History museums. If you are up for it, you can walk to nearby areas such as the Cathedral or even to the Theatre district, but the Tube is about a block or so away on the Picadilly line. Breakfast is not an extravagante affair. The bed I slept in was a bit firm for my tastes, which tends towards the soft side of the Goldilocks scale. There is little street noise, but if this is a factor that you worry about, there are courtyard facing rooms. The staff is very friendly and professional. I've stayed at the Regency about 4 times---so I guess this is indicative of my positive recommendation.
reviews.title: Nice family owned hotel in Kensington as a reasonable price

reviews.text: I stayed at the Regency for 7 nights and It couldn't have been a better experience. The reception staff is very friendly and they are always interested on giving you a great service. The room was always clean, and the location is perfect, just a 2 min walk away from the South Kensington station. I highly recommend staying here.
reviews.title: Excelent service, Great location

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for a course for work and wasn't looking for anything special. The first impressions were good with the reception staff checking me in being courteous, polite and friendly. I made my way up to my room on the second floor which was small but well equipped. I had one problem and that was the noise!
reviews.title: Great hotel let down by noisy bedrooms

reviews.text: The hotel is in converted old town houses and presumably the plumbing is old to, there was a constant noise like a cistern trying to fill up all the time. I tried to put up with it but at 1am I had no patience left. I called the front desk who sent a chap up to listen, he offered to move me but only after asking how many nights I was staying. I got the distinct impression that had it been 1 night only I would have been told, tough.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent four nights at the Regency on their "Club Room" special. The hotel was pleasant, clean, and incredibly convenient. I would come back again if I could get the same discount rate. I can only comment on the Club rooms - which, although small, were larger than many London hotel rooms - not on the other rooms in the hotel. Ours was new, well-furnished, had good electric hookups (although none in the bathroom) and audio and video jacks for the large, flat-screen TV. The breakfast buffet was great (if it comes with your room) but not worth paying for otherwise. I felt a little put out that I was told the room came with "bed and breakfast" but breakfast was a continental buffet. There was plenty to eat, but the "cooked breakfast" cost an extra 4 pounds. My only real beef was the wireless. And that's what makes this a 3 instead of a 4. If they didn't offer wireless, it would be fine. But they sell you a ten pound (for 20 hours) wireless pass that sounds great until you find that the only place in the entire hotel that you can get even as much as 18 mbpi is in the front bay window. Wireless in the room ran from zero to 1 mbps to a top of 5.5. It shouldn't matter so much, but it does. Oh, and try Bistro K around the corner for a great meal, and the Zetland Arms pub for a traditional experience.
reviews.title: Wireless really SHOULDN'T make that much difference...

reviews.text: First stay at the Regency. We were in a recently refurbished room, very pleasant - a decent size by London standards. Very comfortable twin beds, an intelligent lighting system with nightlights in main room and bathroom. The bathroom was also a good size with an excellent shower and it was a nice touch to have bathrobes. Also noted the eco-friendly toiletries in large bottles rather than sample sized ones. There were tea and coffee making facilities in the room and room service is available at an acceptable price.
reviews.title: Great value and fabulous location

reviews.text: The staff were all very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a convenient rea - lots of cafés, bars and restaurants nearby (so the fact that breakfast was not included in the price did not really matter). Well served by public transport.
reviews.title: Great location, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the 4th time that I have stayed at the Regency and will definitely be back. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The location cannot be beat, close to South Kensington and Gloucester Road tube stations and walking distance to Hyde Park, Harrods and the River. The rooms are not huge, but that is to be expected. The new Club Rooms have been updated, the bathroom is good sized and there is plenty of storage. Old Brompton Road has numerous restaurants and a Little Waitrose supermarket. Every time we go back to London we consider changing hotels, but there is no reason to, we have always been pleased with the Regency.
reviews.title: Good location for Royal Albert Hall

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel again because I had a good stay in 2005. The location is excellent, between the So. Kensington and Glouchester tubes, surrounded by restaurants and shops and a self-service laundromat just a block away which was great. When I first arrived, I was given a room on the 5th floor right across from the elevator - the windows were too high to see out, and the bathroom door hit the toilet when the door opened, Since I was staying a week, I went back to the front desk and requested a room with windows I could see out, and away from the elevator. The lady who checked me in was not happy, but the manager transferred me to a room on the 3rd floor, away from the elevator, with a nice view of the street, and a bigger bathroom.
reviews.title: Great location, nice hotel, second visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a great stay.... the price included a lovely full breakfast that included about anything you could want, and though I don't usually eat breakfast, it was just great - the summer berries were fabulous and the dining room is really nice. The room was very clean and well-laid out. They provide a hair dryer and a trouser press, that I used for my wrinkled suitcase clothes. It was quiet, and I will return if I go back to London. I had to request a new bar of soap after about four days, but other than that, it was a perfect stay, and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Delightful Hotel

reviews.text: We have just returned from 5 nights at the Regency and loved the experience. We are Australians and were visiting London on holidays as tourists. The hotel was clean and well appointed and the staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Loved The Regency Great

reviews.text: The hotel is very close to the South Kensington underground and there are many super restaurants nearby and laundromats etc; but being on a side stret, the hotel was very quiet at night.
reviews.title: Worst Place; very unprofessional disdainful staff

likes.disliked: — unprofessional, disdainful, and less than honest staff

reviews.text: The breakfasts were excellent.
reviews.title: Dreadful! Avoid!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall great hotel. On a very busy street but you'd never know it once in the hotel. We did arrive rather early and it would've been nice to go to our room after our lengthy trans-atlantic flight, but it wasn't ready on our arrival so just left our bags and wondered about Hyde Park and environs for a few hours then came back. Staff was friendly enough. Room was nice, on the ground floor with a quaint side street view and amazingly quiet. Nicely decorated bathroom. Would've preferred other toiletries besides body/shampoo combo bottle on shower wall. Tea/coffee amenities (which I desperately need in the morning,,grrr) with complimentary bottled water. Didn't feel like shelling out the additional pounds for the breakfast so couldn't review that. Tons of places near by to have breakfast.
reviews.title: Of course, the location.

reviews.text: Must thank the concierge on duty for helping us with our bungled tours. Must've been jet lag or something but totally screwed up our tour dates so rushed downstairs to get help from the concierge. He was able to contact the local tour operators and rearrange the tours so we wouldn't miss out on them. On our next trip to London, totally staying at the Regency!
reviews.title: Good location near South Kensington and the Museums

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel one night. On the positive side the service of the staff was good but the room I had was for a Club room quite small and for a four star hotel I would expect a minibar and perhaps some details in a folder on the surrounding area. Firstly, I went to the wrong room which was large, king size bed and a settee. This was my fault as I misread the piece of paper with the room number and a porter kindly let me in after also checking the paper but it was not clear. They have a bizzare key system where you hold the card against the lock, twice it did not work for the second room as well. The porter came back and explained this was not my room I was shown to a corner room which has a ventilation outside which was a bit noisy so I moved rooms again to one that was on the first floor but beside the kitchen vents. By this time I had to go to a dinner so just thought sod it. On the plus side the bed was very comfortable and I was so tired fell asleep despite the constant humming outside the window. On the negative side I expect the shower head to be able to be fixed and not fall down all the time when I am having a shower which happened the next morning, plus the entrance to the shower and if you are large bodied you will have problems. I did not have breakfast so cannot comment. Receptionist was going to report to maintenace the problem with the shower. The hotel is also a bit of a maze with rooms and has really narrow hallways and reminded me of a submarine. On the plus side you are only 5-10 minutes to the V&A Museum and others, 5 minutes to South Kensington tube stop and many restaurants.
reviews.title: Good value if on a budget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Air con not working
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No towels on arrival
reviews.title: Excellent location, very friendly staff and lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on a 3 night city break. Beautiful location. Pleasantly surprised. Friendly staff. Room was a good size on 3rd floor, very modern and stylish. Well priced in comparison similar local hotels. Air conditioning needs to be better as it was warm during our stay. In my view breakfast was only average and some waiting staff need training to be alert to customer needs. Would consider staying here again if price was right.
reviews.title: Great location, good selection of restaurants + transport links.

reviews.text: Beautiful looking hotel, located in a quiet neighborhood, close to the Underground station (which means you're a short trip to anywhere in London!) Recently refurbished room. The breakfast room is large with a well equipped Continental Breakfast and the ability to order other breakfast items for a charge. (My son just had to have scrambled eggs with salmon!) The downsides are: extra charges--(1)internet is extra and rarely works adequately. My husband spent a frustrating morning trying to get one business letter out. Finally the front desk gave us a cord and password so we could hardwire our laptop to the internet connection. (Even my Kindle couldn't access their wireless!) (2) Use of tiny gym is extra. (3) Room Numbers: It is funny now, but there is absolutely no rhyme or reason for the room numbers. the 200's may be on one side of the hall and the 500's on the other. There are half floors up, hallways that twist and turn. The hotel must've been made by combining several manor houses. Leave a trail of breadcrumbs in order to find your room again! However the rooms themselves are recently remodeled and comfortable. Might stay here again.
reviews.title: Pleasant beautiful hotel with some underlying irritants

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for two nights for a business conference at a nearby location. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. The room was very clean and up to date, rather small but for a single person it was just fine. The bed was comfortable and I slept well. The room is air conditioned. I signed up for internet but did not have a lot of success with the wireless (rather spotty). It may have been because I was trying to use it on my iPad2. An associate in a room next to me used the eithernet connection and said that the internet was slow. Breakfast was good with the usual choices of breads, jams, orange marmolaid. The choices for cheese and meats was slightly limited. Various grains for cereal and choices of juices. Overall a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel

reviews.text: We spent a week there, and it was not a good experience. The rooms are too small, and there are too many stairs to get to your room that you get missed.
reviews.title: Not even a 3 star hotel

reviews.text: The only thing that's great is the location. The neighbourhood is great, very calm, near the tube and plenty of restaurants.
reviews.title: Good, clean and central

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Regency many times and so have my colleagues and each stay has not been without its problems, 90% of them at check in! The first time I stayed I found the hotel had cancelled my booking and the hotel was full, they weren't interested in finding me a room even though the fault lay with them and not me, that should have been enough to warn me off but I booked once again as the training I attend actually takes place in the hotel so it's easier all round (or so I thought) to stay there. My second attempt was as bad, I had booked a superior Queensgate room which comes with extras such as free wifi, private lounge and access to the gym yet none of this was pointed out to me when I checked in and I had to ask where the gym was, where the lounge was etc. I was in the lounge and needed the wifi password, I asked the barman and he replied that I had to get it from reception, there was no offer to ring and get it from me, oh no, instead I had to pack up all my belongings, laptop, phone, bag etc and trail upstairs to reception to get it. The next day when I arrived at the lounge there was no barman, it's supposed to open at 5, by 5.20 I had enough and trailed upstairs to reception to complain, 5 minutes later a sulky looking barman arrived who proceeded to tell me I shouldn't be in the lounge as I wasn't in a superior room! Every stay since has been pretty much the same, lazy receptionists who are more than prepared to argue the toss with you, even though you are right! My colleagues stayed there recently and even though they had paid for a superior room were shoved in something resembling a broom cupboard and charged for using the gym, even though it was included in the price! My colleague is there now and just text me to say the check in was traumatic, it was the usual story of even though she has booked a superior room the receptionist is saying that she hasn't booked one! Nobody showed her where anything was and the staff were really abrupt and off with her. So take my advice, don't stay here, stay at the Millenium Bailey hotel instead, a far superior hotel with far superior staff.
reviews.title: Don't stay here unless you are prepared to do battle with reception!

reviews.text: Hotel was very well located with two tube station within walking distance. I had a car and was very lucky to be able to find public parking as it was also a weekend when I was there. I use their GYM facility which as rather small but had all the latest equipment that I need. I was also lucky that for the 2 days that I was there I was the only one using the GYM, viewing their records. The rooms were small but decently decorated and very clean. I found their bed on the softer side and would have preferred a firmer mattress. Overall I would still recommend this hotel for its location and helpfull staff.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Centrally located

reviews.text: The Regency hotel has undergone a refurbishment and the rooms are now modern, clean but not entirely spacious. I had a double room and since I was on my own this was fine but with two people it could be a problem. The main issue is the basic design of the room that has the TV and table at the foot of the bed rather than to one side. This means that if someone is working at the table the only way the other person can get from one side of the room to the other is by scrambling over the bed. Not impossible but not ideal. Unlike other reviewers I found the staff friendly, courteous and thoroughly professional. The location is excellent, especially for the museums in South Kensington.
reviews.title: Good but is it good value?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are less expensive hotels in the area so whether this hotel represents good value is debatable. The inclusive breakfast is very basic, juice, coffee and the smallest croissant you have ever seen. As with most hotels the breakfast is ridiculously expensive. I would avoid this, there are lots of cafes just a short walk away around South Kensington underground. These are much better value.
reviews.title: Small Rooms, Great Service, Questionable beds.

reviews.text: The Regency is a fine modern take on an old building, unfortunately owing to its desire to squeeze in the maximum number of rooms to the property it provides very poor value for money.
reviews.title: Earplugs Required!!

reviews.text: Most disturbing nights sleep ever! Kept awake all night by the sound of loud ticking clock, after several investigations in the middle of the night discovered it was coming from the wall behind the bed. On complaining next morning, duty manager pointed out there was a huge electric meter on the other side of the wall on the stair well, on looking at this there were two clocks ticking away! Told other people had complained of noise before, so why put people in there! Also, the room was a dump, discoloured old washed out bedding and towels, not even a picture on the wall, like cell block H! Offered afternoon tea as compensation, refused, disgusted. No way a 4 star hotel. Stay at the Millenium Gloucester Road, 4 star, heaps better!
reviews.title: Nightmare In Room 243
loved it
reviews.text: Dont know what people are complaining about.Lovely hotel.I stayed with my two daughters aged 16 and 20.Our room was a triple room very spacious...yes not the ritz but clean and very quiet and the restaurant was spacious with lovely bar and conservatory.The continental breakfast was excellent.Excellent italian eateries in south kensington.10/10 choice to stay.No rowdy people and great customer service.

We stayed at this hotel just after Christmas in 2007. We turned up at 5am in the morning and weren't due to book i until 2pm that afternoon. However our rooms were available and the lovely staff let us in early without a problem and didn't charge. We stayed there for just over a week and really enjoyed it. The rooms aren't huge but they are comfy and clean. It is located close to the tube and near heaps of fab restaurants. We would deffinately stay there again it was great!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: This was an excellent hotel situated very conveniently near to a tube station and for anyone visiting Knightsbridge or Kensington it was absolutely ideal. The hotel itself is very welcoming and well furnished on entry. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The restaurant was excellent and we enjoyed dinner there on our arrival. Breakfast was superb with a very varied choice suitable for every possible taste. The bedrooms were immaculately clean and warm with good facilities. If we had a complaint it was that the bedroom and bathroom was small but we knew that before we went, having read reviews prior to booking, so that was not a problem for us.
reviews.title: Excellent value

likes.liked: — Good quality and immaculately presented hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We felt the price we paid was good value for money, given that we were staying in a more expensive part of London and we did shop around on the internet for the best deal at that hotel.
reviews.title: Good Location

likes.disliked: — Noise outside the room - from the heating/kitchens possibly?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: it was 4 star hotel, but 20 years ago!! very small rooms, the suite was bigger, but a lot more expensive, very old. clean but it felt dirty and dark. will never use again.
reviews.title: bad, very very bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was not even close to 3.5 stars which hotwire had this hotel listed as. The price was good thru hotwire, but the service was not very good. The room was small and creaky and not in the best shape, and we could hear people walking and talking around us. The Jury Kensington is across the street and was much nicer. I wouldnt stay here again.
reviews.title: There are better places for the money

likes.disliked: — The staff was not friendly, not Brittish, pretty rute!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Regency when I attended a business course at the hotel.After reading previous reviews I was unsure what to expect but was, however pleasently surprised.
reviews.title: Good Standard accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was upgraded from a single to a twin bedded room on the ground floor. Although not a big room it was exceptionally clean, the bed linen was freshly laundered and bathroom of a high standard.
reviews.title: terrible

reviews.text: There was occasion noise from other guests retiring to bed late but nothing too disturbing (and I am a light sleeper!).
reviews.title: Comfortable for a few days stay

reviews.text: We stayed at the Regency Queensgate for he third time in September 2011. We had stayed in 2005 anbd 2008, and kept returning because of the location and the pricepoint of the hotel. Each stay became a bit less impressive. This time, the hotel was completely changed into a more sleek, modern, marble and chrome from the more "English Country" feel - still nice, still great location, but just not as comfortable and friendly. Our room had a view of the back of the property onto alley rooftops, which was very disappointing, since we were staying for a week.
reviews.title: Not as good as before

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One day, as I was walking through the lower level to get to the computer area, I was admonished by a manager, and made to go up the stairs, then back down, so I could go through the lobby. An unnecessary requirement in my opinion; but fortunately I do not have a problem with stairs. We were also scolded for leaving out of the side door, instead of the front door by the lobby when we went out in the mornings. It wasn't after hours, and it was out of the way to always go through the lobby.
reviews.title: Modern Hotel in a Great Location

reviews.text: To top it off, a friend had to cancel her room at the Regency because of travel problems with Greece. Because she did not give 24 hours notice, they would not let her cancel without charging her for a night's stay. Even though she explained that this was our third trip, they would not help her. We will not stay here again, they've become too much like a large, uncaring chain, I'm sad to say.
reviews.title: Avoid this hotel if at all possible.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in the hotel over a weekend in November 2011.
reviews.title: Regency Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was lovely inside and our room was very modern. We stayed in a double bed room on the ground floor, which I think is their lowest standard of room that is offered. The room was very modern with all standard amenities and very clean. The room was quite small though, but more than adequate for our 3 night stay.
reviews.title: HOTEL

reviews.text: The Regency is not anymore what it was... for example in my room I had a VHS recorder!? The rooms need renovation, as also the bathrooms. The breakfast was good and staff was friendly. Bar has no ambiance.
reviews.title: Needs some renovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, walking distance to all the Kensington attractions (Harrods etc), museums (eg V&A), tube with a direct line to Heathrow, and plenty of eateries both in Kensington and down Old Brompton Road. However, although the area is nice and outside appearance lovely, the rooms and bathrooms here disappoint and are small for a 4* even by UK standards, the buffet breakfast only of average quality, and our shower pressure was very poor even after a maintenance visit. You can definitely get better value for money either in this area or elsewhere in London.
reviews.title: Great location...not so great value for money
Awful, overpriced and cramped.
reviews.text: A prime example of the rip-off that London Hotels have become. From the rude reception staff to the minute room, the lack of even a kettle to to the malfunctioning 20 year old TV set this hotel disappoints. As a 6ft 5 man, a single child sized bed and 1980s sheets and blankets were simply unacceptable. As an ex-Londoner, who visits the capital regularly for work, I would be embarassed to take a visitor here!! And £6 for a bottle of water??????

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were surprised at how small the room was when we first entered our hotel room, but after some getting used to, this was a wonderful hotel to stay in. The bed was comfortable, everything was always very clean and neat. The tub was very narrow, but long. The shower head was a little low, which mades it hard if you are tall! But overall the room was great. The breakfast in the morning was amazing, excellent selection of food for a continental breakfast. The location was perfect and close by to great restaurants and shopping. We walked everywhere, and there was always something interesting to see. Some of the staff at the hotel were a litte rude, but we were not there to make friend with the staff, so if one is not concerned with that, then this is a great place to stay overall. If we go to London again, I would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

likes.disliked: — A little small, but it was okay!

reviews.text: I booked a single room through Hotwire and the price paid was the only redeeming thing about the stay.
reviews.title: Nice on the outside...
